documents.document: We may also want to factor in that many people round and measure in grass.
If youâ€™ve been on the Mall or around Arlington during a snow event it looks just like DCA measurements .
Or people should stop caring so much I had 0.4â€ more itâ€™s a fine measurement. https://t.co/doozcqDfl0
Klingle Trail in NW DC. #WinterStormGia #snurlough https://t.co/ZFmQlacqAb
It is a #WinterWonderland in DC today. https://t.co/oNb6yVe2b2
@jcolman22 Northwesrt maybe2 miles from md border
RT @joecody5: Just coming down in Silver Spring now. Heaviest snow of the day @capitalweather @dougkammerer @islivingston https://t.co/PvMsâ€¦

@cwgNAS @TerpWeather @mapgirl18 I do think it's that many of the people who have the free time to follow weather that close tend to live in NW or north and west in general. I get it sorta but it also feels a little like a pissing contest.
RT @cwgNAS: @islivingston @TerpWeather @mapgirl18 Same dynamic in Arlington.

@rms5539 yeah that's a good idea might have to look into it. I forget how old the station is. Arboretum is a good one too although the coops do 12-12z but should still be workable if they report enough. there are some other locations that are in theory better but seems move doubtful.

The fall line is fun. I know less than I should but @TerpWeather or @mapgirl18 might know more... it cuts thru DC. If you've spent much time in DC you know the NW part is very hilly and there is a general slope rise overall. 95 more or less follows it in most of this region. https://t.co/007UNkBTUu

@rms5539 snow measuring is just a bad thing overall.. it's always amusing how terribly people do considering it's such a simple concept. I guess in a lot of ways I just think of them in their buckets rather than specifics but that's because I look at numbers too much perhaps.

@rms5539 it's def not targeted at you.. you just reminded. I actually wanted to write a post refuting the idea that moving to the WH would make much difference but think it ended up a little to niche or something. people have an odd focus on DCA tho-better than many cities climate loc.
RT @MrTinDC: @islivingston Sigh, have to clean off my stoop and sidewalk for third time, because each time I think the storm is over, it coâ€¦
Hard part now is getting proper totals because the older stuff has compacted. Partly why the pros use a snowboard (although I'm guessing very few of the public does).
Good news is DCA is going over 6â€ anyway. 1-2â€ per hour rates in the heavies here. https://t.co/3sEla1cilr
I looked at like 40 condos when I was searching and I think 2 were east of the fall line because of this issue.

The Mall is near sea level to about 20 feet. White House maybe 30ish. Dupont Circle close to 100. If you're east of the fall line you don't have much elevation in general. DCA is rather representative of downtown.

Zoo reported 5.9 at 12:45 which was close to my 5.8 at 11a. American had 6 at 11:40a. DCA 5.4 at 1p.
DCA is at about 10-15 feet elevation. Zoo around 200 feet. American around 300 feet. Almost exactly how you'd expect the numbers to look on that alone.
RT @chrishchurch: @islivingston Thumping in Burke, VA. Easily added 2 more inches today
@splillo Interesting havenâ€™t thought of it but could see that. Does make it more fun. I like heavy snow but a slow pile up is better in many ways.
RT @Vaphilly624: @islivingston https://t.co/MU4szDaQOh
@hbwx Not sure we can pull 10 widespread but this stuff is putting up totals fast to it has to evaporate soon to keep us below.
RT @cwgNAS: @islivingston 7â€ in N Arlington.
RT @mapgirl18: @islivingston @TerpWeather Fall line is def a good arbitrary line to follow on elevation. LWX has done a fairly good job splâ€¦
We aren't great at winter overall here but we tend to close out storms well.
Kayak days https://t.co/pQNpjXF0qx
@pastepunk nice! the duration is something. snow is good at sticking to snow. guess we can still get around 8 or so although compaction will prob grow as an issue.

@DistrictWino @waclark4 @capitalweather I almost always walk up to wisconsin in smaller events.. tonight CT was oversalted and the dog wasn't a fan so it seemed to make sense. could wander the hills around here forever.
@crankywxguy @DTVaWeatherman @whatisthisrds you of all people should give #jetweirding its due anyway. I didn't say we were getting 80" this winter. might have to wait a few.
I forget these are niche acronyms. I think @DTVaWeatherman invented them. HECS = historic east coast storm. SECS, MECS, HECS, BECS(?) ... significant, major, historic, biblical ;)

@cwgNAS @TerpWeather @mapgirl18 was going to mention that storm b/c @markellinwood and I were in that area and it was very noticeable how much worse it was than surrounding areas. it is a bit of a microclimate but prob still covers a good area near the potomac and downtown.
@antmasiello @mattross72 he said .4 in 15ish so I rounded a bit but also think heavier was not there. I should go look I guess I hate measuring hah.
Lowest visibility of the storm at DCA now with 1/4 mile and mod snow reported. https://t.co/JGkzKw5TdU
@antmasiello well partly based on ground confirmation from @mattross72 tho I suppose I rounded up a bit. he wasn't in the heaviest either but could be right for sure. getting into it now here.
